Detailed Description

Define Documentation

#define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN

Function Documentation

bool BWProcessOutstandingMessages (  ) 

The function processes all outstanding windows messages and returns when there are non-remaining or a WM_QUIT is received.

Returns:
Returns false if a WM_QUIT was encountered, otherwise true.

int BWWinMain ( HINSTANCE  hInstance,
LPCTSTR  lpCmdLine,
int  nCmdShow,
LPCTSTR  lpClassName,
LPCTSTR  lpWindowName 
)

This function is the BigWorld implementation of WinMain and contains the message pump.

Before this function is called the application should already have registered a WNDCLASS with class name lpClassName. The registered WndProc function should also call BWWndProc.

Parameters:
hInstance The instance handle passed to WinMain.
lpCmdLine The command line string passed to WinMain.
nCmdShow The initial window state passed to WinMain.
lpClassName The name of the WNDCLASS previously registered.
lpWindowName The window title for the program.
Returns:
The wParam value of the WM_QUIT that should be returned by WinMain.

LRESULT BWWndProc ( HWND  hWnd,
UINT  msg,
WPARAM  wParam,
LPARAM  lParam 
)

This function is the BigWorld implementation of WndProc which should be called by the WndProc registered when the application was started.

Parameters:
hWnd The window handle associated with the current windows message.
msg The message passed to WndProc
wParam Additional message parameter passed to WndProc
lParam Additional message parameter passed to WndProc
Returns:
DefWindowProc will be called if the message is not otherwise handled.

Variable Documentation

const char* compileTimeString

bool g_bAppQuit

bool g_bAppStarted

This is set to true just before Finale app calls start on the personality script.
